summary:
• Type of Announcement: Ongoing Disclosure Notice (Directors' Interests)
  • Key Points:
  • Former CFO Margaret Warrington sold 117,859 EROAD Limited (ERD) shares on-market on 13-Jun-2025.
  • Total consideration: NZD 177,890.60 (avg. ~NZD 1.51/share).
  • Holding post-sale: 0 shares (full exit).

No material trading or capital markets impact identified (routine director interest disclosure).

(Note: Omitted boilerplate details per rules; no structural, liquidity, or valuation implications.)

KMD Brands Trading Update – Material Information Summary

Financial & Operational Highlights:

  • Sales Performance (unaudited, 10 months to May 2025):
  • Rip Curl: +0.4% YOY (DTC growth, wholesale still below prior year).
  • Kathmandu: -1.0% YOY (recent June DTC sales +13.2%, weather-impacted winter categories).
  • Oboz: -4.1% YOY (wholesale improving, online sales above prior year despite US tariff uncertainty).

  • Group Total: -0.5% YOY.

  • Online Sales: +10.7% YTD, +26.1% post-Kathmandu platform upgrade (May 2025).

  • Gross Margin: Down 140bps YOY due to competitive pricing.

  • FY25 EBITDA Guidance: $15M–$25M (tariff impact: ~$1M).

  • Net Debt Forecast (31 July 2025): ~NZ$70M (working capital focus, inventory lower than FY24).

  • US Tariffs: Uncertainty persists; monitoring demand impact.

  • Banking Covenants: Amended terms agreed; expects compliance at 31 July 2025.

Forward-Looking:

  • Investor Day (September 2025): Plans for growth initiatives to be disclosed.

No capital markets actions (e.g., raising, halt) identified.

• Buy-back Type: On-market buy-back
  • Total Shares Bought Back (Prior to Previous Day): 155,439
  • Shares Bought Back on Previous Day (17/6/2025): 37,570
  • Total Consideration Paid (Previous Day): AUD 19,524.59
  • Highest/Lowest Price Paid (Previous Day): AUD 0.525 / AUD 0.510
  • Buy-back Period: 13/5/2025 to 29/4/2026
  • Buy-back Cap: Up to 5% of issued shares (~5.1m shares based on 101,964,147 outstanding).
  • Broker: Ord Minnett Limited

No other material information identified.

Substantial Holding Disclosure Summary

  • Entity: Steven Newman & NMC Trustees Ltd (NMC Investment Trust)
  • Company: EROAD Limited (NZX: ERD)
  • Key Changes:
  • Steven Newman’s holding: Reduced from 7.290% (13,474,111 shares) to 5.347% (10,020,952 shares).
  • NMC Trust’s holding: Reduced from 7.195% (13,297,083 shares) to 5.257% (9,853,024 shares).
  • Recent Transactions:
  • 26 Feb 2024 – 30 May 2025: NMC Trust sold 1,444,059 shares (~0.771% stake) for A$1.35M (NZ$1.45M).
  • 13 Jun 2025: NMC Trust sold 2,000,000 shares (~1.07% stake) for A$2.82M (NZ$3.03M).
  • Current Control: Steven Newman retains influence over ~5.35% via direct/NMC Trust holdings + minor family interests.

Material Impact: Significant reduction in insider stakes (>2% combined decrease), signaling potential loss of confidence or liquidity event. Omit non-transactional details (e.g., family holdings <0.01%).

Format adheres to ECM brevity rules, isolating actionable trading signals.

• Non-binding term sheet signed with Genesis, Mercury, Meridian, and Contact to establish a strategic energy reserve centered on Huntly Power Station, aimed at addressing national energy security.
  • Key driver: Response to 2024 winter supply constraints (declining gas supply, low hydro/wind) and medium-term gas supply risks.
  • Proposal details: Extend operation of Huntly’s Rankine Units (planned retirement deferred from 2026/2030s) to 2035, with a 10-year term. Includes fuel reserve and potential biomass transition.
  • Timeline: Target implementation by 1 January 2026; certainty required by early November 2025 for operational readiness.
  • Market impact: Residual capacity to be offered via Huntly Firming Options and hedge products.

Omitted: Background details, contact info, boilerplate.
